It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers with a unique coloration pattern. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories where it relies on mycorrhizal fungi for nutrient uptake. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, Pedilonum buffumiae is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
